title: VERA FILES FACT CHECK: Does Saudi Arabia provide 80% of the Philippines’ oil?
subtitle: During his business trip to the Middle East, President Rodrigo Duterte thanked Saudi Arabia for its contributions to the Philippine economy: jobs for Filipino workers and oil supply.
author: www.verafiles.org
vclaim:
During his business trip to the Middle East, President Rodrigo Duterte thanked Saudi Arabia for its contributions to the Philippine economy: jobs for Filipino workers and oil supply.

Speaking before the Riyadh Chamber of Commerce and Industry on April 12, Duterte said the Philippines gets 80 percent of its oil supply solely from Saudi Arabia.

In terms of crude oil, the president got his figures wrong.

Data from the Department of Energy in 2016 show 87 percent of the total crude oil supply was sourced from the entire Middle East in 2016, with Saudi Arabia, Kuwait, United Arab Emirates, Oman and Qatar comprising the chunk.

Only 36.1 percent or a total of 28,438,000 barrels (28,438 thousand barrels) came from Saudi Arabia. He must have mistaken the country for the entire region.

In 2016, Saudi Arabia supplied a total of 28,438,000 barrels (28,438 thousand barrels) of oil to the Philippines.

The rest is from neighboring ASEAN countries and local production.
